course.title: Conditional Equality: The Case of the Jews of Europe in Modern Times
course.meeting_text: M., W., (F.), at 12, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.faculty_text: Jay M. Harris (Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations)
course.description: This course is a study in the relations between majorities and minorities in modern Europe, using the Jews as a focus. It will examine the ways in which the equal status of a minority is negotiated through cultural and political interaction, both subtle and blunt. It will further focus on the role that such negotiations have in the formation of identities of both the majority and the minority. Finally, it will examine the ways in which majorities can exercise control over minorities rendering them conditionally rather than fully equal participants in the national projects of the age.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
